text: Ladislaus Löb (8 May 1933 – 2 October 2021Swiss Holocaust survivor and member of ‘Kasztner group’ dies) was a Romanian-Swiss Germanist and Holocaust survivor. He was the Professor Emeritus of German at the University of Sussex in England. He wrote From Lessing to Hauptmann: Studies in German Drama (1974) and Christian Dietrich Grabbe (1996). Löb is also known for having been a passenger, when he was 11 years old, on the Kastner train during the Holocaust. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Swiss academics Category:Holocaust survivors Category:University of Sussex
